result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob D. Petterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob D. Petterson

records.addlTxt:
2:01 p.m.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA to: 
COUNT 1: Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Injunction >> NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: $25.00 fine; DNA sample and surcharge; and remits CC. 

Adj: 2:15 p.m.
Jury status hearing on September 13, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

4:00p.m. 
Clerk Micki.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Date and time set for a JPTC. VRCW. 

COURT addresses Defendant regarding right of counsel.
DDA Lawrence makes statement regarding counsel. Sent a letter to Defendant. 
Defendant make statement regarding letter.  Does not have a problem with the resolution.
COURT addresses Defendant's blood pressure and what happened prior to going on the record. Will not take a plea today. 
Defendant makes statements.

NEXT DATES >> keep on as scheduled. 
JSH - 9/13/22 at 1:45p.m. (send plea questionnaire)
JT - 10/20/22 at 9:00a.m.

ADJ: 4:08p.m.

State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person; pro se
Defendant's Understanding of Prosecutor's Role completed by defendant.
DATES: keep on as scheduled

Pre-trial conference on June 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on July 18, 2022 at 03:50 pm.
Jury status hearing on September 13, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Jury Trial on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): C.M.K. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Micki. 
Case called: 2:30p.m.

State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence.  Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY

COURT ORDERS: $250.00 signature bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): C.M.K.
- Prints and photograph. 

Dates:
PTC: 06/16/2020 at 2:30p.m.
JPTC: 07/18/2022 3:50p.m.
JSH: 09/13/2022 at 1:45p.m.
JT: 10/20/2022 at 9:00a.m.

Adj: 2:35p.m.

BOTR: 2:47p.m.

Same appearances

Defendant makes statement regarding not being able to be fingerprinted and photographed today.

COURT notes the Clerk's office found somebody to assist the defendant.

ADJ: 2:48p.m.
